name: 陳維昌
objective:
The course aims to provide an introduction to probability which is a useful and fundamental mathematical tool for EE students. The course contains the following topics:

1. Experiments, Models, and Probabilities
2. Discrete Random Variables 
3. Continuous Random Variables
4. Pairs of Random Variables
5. Random Vectors
6. Sums of Random Variables
schedule:
Weeks 01~03: Experiments, Models, and Probabilities
Weeks 04~06: Discrete Random Variables 
Weeks 07~08: Continuous Random Variables
Week     09: Midterm Exam
Week     10: Continuous Random Variables
Weeks 11~13: Pairs of Random Variables
Week     14: Random Vectors
Weeks 15~17: Sums of Random Variables
Week     18: Final Exam

The schedule may be adjusted if necessary.
scorePolicy:
Matlab Assignment 30%
Midterm Exam      35%
Final Exam        35%
materials: Roy D. Yates and David J. Goodman, Probability and Stochastic Processes: A Friendly Introduction for Electrical and Computer Engineers, 2nd Edition, Wiley, 2004.
